name: Ten Days In November Quiz | Famous Dates | 10 Questions

questions.text: Guy Fawkes' plan to overthrow the English Government on November 5, 1605 is better known as what?
questions.explanation:
The Gunpowder Plot.

	The failure of the plot is celebrated every year and is known as Fireworks Night or Guy Fawkes Night.

questions.text: One of the most memorable speeches in history took place in the dark days of the American Civil War, on November 19, 1863. What was it?
options: Frederick Douglas' The Hypocrisy of American Slavery
Susan B. Anthony on Women's Right to Vote
Elizabeth Cady Stanton - The Destructive Male
questions.explanation:
Abraham Lincoln's Gettysburg Address.

	Lincoln's historic speech is often quoted in school plays.

questions.text: This important 20th century figure was born on November 30, 1874. Who was he?
questions.explanation:
Winston Churchill.

	Sir Winston was born in Blenheim Palace, Oxfordshire, England. Accounts vary on where exactly in the palace he was born.

questions.text: What happened at the eleventh hour, on the eleventh day, of the eleventh month of 1918?
questions.correct: Fighting in World War I ended with an armistice
options: The presidential address to the nation was broadcast on radio for the first time
questions.explanation:
Fighting in World War I ended with an armistice.

	The significance of the event was celebrated as Armistice Day. It later became Veterans Day in the USA.

questions.text: Which future action film star was born on November 27, 1940?
questions.explanation:
Bruce Lee.

	Bruce Lee died in Hong Kong when he was just 32 years old.

questions.text: Dealy Plaza, Dallas, November 22, 1963, the President's motorcade just entered the square, a man is filming this historic event. Who was the man?
questions.explanation:
Abraham Zapruder.

	Mr. Zapruder had no idea that his 26 second, eight millimeter film, would become one of the most analyzed pieces of film in history.

Francisco Franco.

	Franco ruled Spain from 1939 until his death in 1975.

questions.text: On November 18, 1978 over 900 cult members comitted suicide on the orders of their leader Jim Jones. What was the cult called?
questions.explanation:
The People's Temple.

	The macabre event took place in the middle of the jungles of Guyana, at a place named after the cult leader, Jonestown.

questions.text: On November 4, 1979, Iranian terrorists stormed the American Embassy in Tehran, Iran, and held 53 people hostage for over one year. What was their initial reason for doing this?
questions.correct: The presence of the former Shah of Iran in the U.S.
options: America's refusal to clear Iran's foreign debt
questions.explanation:
The presence of the former Shah of Iran in the U.S.

	The hostages' plight was publicised every night on prime time tv. They were not released until January 1981.

questions.text: What started to come down on November 9, 1989?
questions.explanation:
The Berlin Wall.

	Erected in 1961, the wall stood as the vivid symbol of the Cold War for nearly thirty years.
